t: To the chief Musician upon Nehiloth, A Psalm of David.
Give*p ear to my words, O Lord,*s consider my meditation.
Hearken*p unto the voice of my cry, my King, and my God: for unto thee will I pray.
My*p voice shalt thou hear in the morning, O Lord;*s in the morning will I direct my prayer unto thee, and will look up.
For*p thou art not a God that hath pleasure in wickedness: neither shall evil dwell with thee.
The*p foolish shall not stand in thy sight: thou hatest all workers of iniquity.
Thou*p shalt destroy them that speak leasing: the Lord*s will abhor the bloody and deceitful man.
But*p as for me, I will come into thy house in the multitude of thy mercy: and in thy fear will I worship toward thy holy temple.
Lead*p me, O Lord,*s in thy righteousness because of mine enemies; make thy way straight before my face.
For*p there is no faithfulness in their mouth; their inward part is very wickedness; their throat is an open sepulchre; they flatter with their tongue.
Destroy*p thou them, O God; let them fall by their own counsels; cast them out in the multitude of their transgressions; for they have rebelled against thee.
But*p let all those that put their trust in thee rejoice: let them ever shout for joy, because thou defendest them: let them also that love thy name be joyful in thee.
For*p thou, Lord,*s wilt bless the righteous; with favour wilt thou compass him as with a shield.
